author: The Linux Foundation
description:
The automotive industry has undergone significant transformations in recent years, with a growing focus on software-driven innovations. However, this shift has also introduced new challenges, particularly in terms of software fragmentation. 

Historically, automakers have relied on different computer hardware running different operating systems and software platforms for each model year, resulting in a fragmented landscape. This approach has led to increased costs, complexity, and difficulties in managing software updates. 

As Dan Cauchy, Executive Director of AGL at the Linux Foundation, explains, “AGL was created to alleviate that problem by creating a single platform that everybody builds on top of." By providing a standardized software base, AGL enables automakers to focus on developing their unique features and services, rather than rebuilding the underlying software for each model year.

Initially focused on infotainment, AGL now includes instrument clusters, heads-up displays
title: How Open Source Is Revolutionizing The Automotive Industry With AGL | Dan Cauchy

author: The Linux Foundation
description:
In this week’s LF Quick Hits, we cover:
✅ DeepSeek’s AI breakthrough – showing that ingenuity, not just compute, wins the AI race.
✅ New OpenSSF security framework – open source projects now have a tiered roadmap to better security.
✅ NVIDIA’s RISC-V evolution – billions of cores shipped, and the reason why.
✅ Faster search with OpenSearch – bitmap filtering slashes query times for massive datasets.
✅ Kubescape’s CNCF promotion – Kubernetes security just got stronger.

 Want to dive deeper into this week’s top open-source stories?
 DeepSeek’s AI revolution & why it matters for Europe → https://dub.sh/deepseek-europe
 OpenSSF’s Project Security Baseline for OSS security → https://dub.sh/project-security-baseline
 NVIDIA explains why RISC-V is powering their microcontrollers → https://dub.sh/nvidia-riscv
 OpenSearch’s bitmap filtering speeds up queries → https://dub.sh/bitmap-filtering
 Kubescape joins CNCF incubation for Kubernetes security → https://dub.sh/kubescape-cncf
title: 🌍 Open source is driving massive innovation across AI, security, and cloud-native tech.
